banner.outerBackground.image.title: image
banner.outerBackground.image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

banner.font.color.title: Color
banner.font.color.description: Sets the color the components's text. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)
banner.font.color.markdownDescription: Sets the color the components's text. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

banner.font.size.title: Size
banner.font.size.description: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.
banner.font.size.markdownDescription: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.

banner.font.weight.title: Weight
banner.font.weight.description: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.
banner.font.weight.markdownDescription: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.

banner.font.lineHeight.title: Line Height
banner.font.lineHeight.description: Sets the distance between lines of text.
banner.font.lineHeight.markdownDescription: Sets the distance between lines of text.

banner.font.shadow.title: Text Shadow
banner.font.shadow.description: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)
banner.font.shadow.markdownDescription: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)

banner.font.align.title: Alignment
banner.font.align.description: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.
banner.font.align.markdownDescription: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.

banner.font.transform.title: Transform

callToAction.options.box.borderType.title: Border Type
callToAction.options.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
callToAction.options.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

callToAction.options.box.itemSpacing.title: Box - Item Spacing

callToAction.options.box.background.size.markdownDescription: Set the background size of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size)

callToAction.options.box.background.imag.title: image
callToAction.options.box.background.imag.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".
callToAction.options.box.background.imag.markdownDescription:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

callToAction.options.box.background.unse.title: Ignore Default Background
callToAction.options.box.background.unse.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
callToAction.options.box.background.unse.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

titleBar.overlay.background.title: Background Overlay
titleBar.overlay.background.description:
An background to overlay on top of a background image if one is specified.
Accepts any value that works for a CSS "background" property.
This can be useful to add contrast to a titlebar background that otherwise might not have enough.
titleBar.overlay.background.markdownDescription:
An background to overlay on top of a background image if one is specified.
Accepts any value that works for a CSS "background" property.
This can be useful to add contrast to a titlebar background that otherwise might not have enough.

titleBar.colors.fg.title: Foreground/Text Color
titleBar.colors.fg.description:
Foreground color for the titlebar.
It's recommended that this color have sufficient color with the background color.
titleBar.colors.fg.markdownDescription:
Foreground color for the titlebar.
It's recommended that this color have sufficient color with the background color.

titleBar.colors.bg.title: Background Color
titleBar.colors.bg.description:
Background color for the titlebar.
It's recommended that this color have sufficient color with the foreground color.
titleBar.colors.bg.markdownDescription:
Background color for the titlebar.
It's recommended that this color have sufficient color with the foreground color.

titleBar.colors.bgImage.title: Background Image
titleBar.colors.bgImage.description:
Apply a background image over the Title Bar.
This image will will fill the full background of the Title Bar and will not be stretched.
It's recommended to use a very wide patterned image,
of which the middle portion make sense on it's own (for mobile devices.)
This should be a full URL to an image.
titleBar.colors.bgImage.markdownDescription:
Apply a background image over the Title Bar.
This image will will fill the full background of the Title Bar and will not be stretched.
It's recommended to use a very wide patterned image,
of which the middle portion make sense on it's own (for mobile devices.)
This should be a full URL to an image.

titleBar.colors.state.bg.title: Foreground Color (State)
titleBar.colors.state.bg.description:
The foreground hover/state color for various buttons in the Title Bar.
It is recommended that this color have strong contrast with the background color.
By default this color is generated based on the regular color.
titleBar.colors.state.bg.markdownDescription:
The foreground hover/state color for various buttons in the Title Bar.
It is recommended that this color have strong contrast with the background color.
By default this color is generated based on the regular color.

titleBar.border.color.title: color
titleBar.border.color.description: Set the color of the border.
titleBar.border.color.markdownDescription: Set the color of the border.

titleBar.border.width.title: width
titleBar.border.width.description: Set the width of the border. Numerical units are interpretted as pixels.
titleBar.border.width.markdownDescription: Set the width of the border. Numerical units are interpretted as pixels.

titleBar.border.style.title: style
titleBar.border.style.description: Set the style of the border.

titleBar.border.radius.description: Set the radius of the border. Numerical units are interpretted as pixels.
titleBar.border.radius.markdownDescription: Set the radius of the border. Numerical units are interpretted as pixels.

titleBar.swoop.amount.title: Amount
titleBar.swoop.amount.description:
Create a curved bottom border on the Title Bar.
Larger numbers give a bigger "swoop". Please note that this adds some additional space into the bottom of the titlebar.
A value of 10 gives a very subtle swoop that should not require much adjustment elsewhere.
A value of 50 gives a very pronounced swoop and will require adjustments in padding to compensate.
The follow variables should be used together to fine your desired swoop.
titleBar.swoop.amount.markdownDescription:
Create a curved bottom border on the Title Bar.
Larger numbers give a bigger "swoop". Please note that this adds some additional space into the bottom of the titlebar.
A value of 10 gives a very subtle swoop that should not require much adjustment elsewhere.
A value of 50 gives a very pronounced swoop and will require adjustments in padding to compensate.
The follow variables should be used together to fine your desired swoop.

titleBar.swoop.swoopOffset.title: Offset
titleBar.swoop.swoopOffset.description:
This parameter determines how much the swoop extends "outside" of the TitleBar
Large offsets may require adjustments in padding.
The follow variables should be used together to fine your desired swoop.
titleBar.swoop.swoopOffset.markdownDescription:
This parameter determines how much the swoop extends "outside" of the TitleBar
Large offsets may require adjustments in padding.
The follow variables should be used together to fine your desired swoop.

titleBar.fullBleed.enabled.title: Enabled
titleBar.fullBleed.enabled.description:
Enable a "full bleed" title bar.
This caused to titlebar to be transparent or semi-transparent and site *on top* of the banner.
titleBar.fullBleed.enabled.markdownDescription:
Enable a "full bleed" title bar.
This caused to titlebar to be transparent or semi-transparent and site *on top* of the banner.

titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity.title: Starting Opacity
titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity.description:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
when sitting on top of the banner.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid
titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity.markdownDescription:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
when sitting on top of the banner.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid

titleBar.fullBleed.endingOpacity.title: Ending Opacity
titleBar.fullBleed.endingOpacity.description:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
as the banner is scrolled out of view.
The banner *always* becomes completely solid after the transition,
so this value only affects the transition between states.
This value cannot be less than the `titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity` value.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid
titleBar.fullBleed.endingOpacity.markdownDescription:
An opacity value between 0 and 1 that determins how transparent the full bleed titlebar is
as the banner is scrolled out of view.
The banner *always* becomes completely solid after the transition,
so this value only affects the transition between states.
This value cannot be less than the `titleBar.fullBleed.startingOpacity` value.
0 - Fully transparent.
0.3 - Semi transparent.
1 - Completely solid

titleBar.fullBleed.bgColor.title: Background Color
titleBar.fullBleed.bgColor.description:
The background color of the full bleed titlebar when it is transparent/semi-transparent.
This defaults to the normal titleBar.colors.bg color, but can be a different color.
For example, you may want to use a semi-transparent white/black while overlaying the banner,
but want the titlebar to transition a brand color when on it's own or scrolled down the page.
titleBar.fullBleed.bgColor.markdownDescription:
The background color of the full bleed titlebar when it is transparent/semi-transparent.
This defaults to the normal titleBar.colors.bg color, but can be a different color.
For example, you may want to use a semi-transparent white/black while overlaying the banner,
but want the titlebar to transition a brand color when on it's own or scrolled down the page.

titleBar.logo.doubleLogoStrategy.title: Double Logo Strategy
titleBar.logo.doubleLogoStrategy.description:
A strategy for dealing with multiple logos when using a custom theme header with the titlebar.
- visible (default) - Always show the logo in the titlebar.
- hidden - Hide the logo in the titlebar.
- fade-in - Fade the logo in after the custom theme header scrolls of the page.
titleBar.logo.doubleLogoStrategy.markdownDescription:
A strategy for dealing with multiple logos when using a custom theme header with the titlebar.
- visible (default) - Always show the logo in the titlebar.
- hidden - Hide the logo in the titlebar.
- fade-in - Fade the logo in after the custom theme header scrolls of the page.

titleBar.logo.offsetRight.title: Right Margin
titleBar.logo.offsetRight.description: Apply some spacing between the logo and the navigation items.
titleBar.logo.offsetRight.markdownDescription: Apply some spacing between the logo and the navigation items.

_Note: The navigation cannot use center alignment while the logo placement is set to center.

- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png

homeWidgetItem.options.box.borderType.title: Border Type
homeWidgetItem.options.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
homeWidgetItem.options.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

list.options.box.borderType.title: Border Type
list.options.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
list.options.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

list.options.box.background.image.title: image
list.options.box.background.image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

quickLinks.box.borderType.title: Border Type
quickLinks.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
quickLinks.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

quickLinks.box.itemSpacing.title: Quick Links - Box - Item Spacing
quickLinks.box.itemSpacing.description: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.
quickLinks.box.itemSpacing.markdownDescription: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.

quickLinks.box.itemSpacingOnAllItems.markdownDescription: Apply the item spacing even on the first and last items.

quickLinks.box.background.image.title: image
quickLinks.box.background.image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".
quickLinks.box.background.image.markdownDescription:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

quickLinks.box.background.unsetBackgroun.title: Ignore Default Background
quickLinks.box.background.unsetBackgroun.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
quickLinks.box.background.unsetBackgroun.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

quickLinks.listItem.listSeparation.title: List Separation
quickLinks.listItem.listSeparation.description:
Describe how the list items should be separated from each other.
- none - The list items only have whitespace between them.
- border - The list items each have a full border and whitespace between the borders.
- separator - There is whitespace and a single line separating 2 items.
quickLinks.listItem.listSeparation.markdownDescription:
Describe how the list items should be separated from each other.
- none - The list items only have whitespace between them.
- border - The list items each have a full border and whitespace between the borders.
- separator - There is whitespace and a single line separating 2 items.

breadcrumbs.separator.font.align.markdownDescription: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.

breadcrumbs.separator.font.transform.title: Transform
breadcrumbs.separator.font.transform.description: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.
breadcrumbs.separator.font.transform.markdownDescription: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.

breadcrumbs.separator.font.letterSpacing.title: Letter Spacing
breadcrumbs.separator.font.letterSpacing.description: Sets the spacing behavior between text characters.
breadcrumbs.separator.font.letterSpacing.markdownDescription: Sets the spacing behavior between text characters.

breadcrumbs.separator.font.textDecoratio.title: Text Decoration
breadcrumbs.separator.font.textDecoratio.description: Apply some decoration to the text.
breadcrumbs.separator.font.textDecoratio.markdownDescription: Apply some decoration to the text.

searchWidget.options.box.borderType.title: Border Type
searchWidget.options.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
searchWidget.options.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

searchWidget.options.box.itemSpacing.title: User Spotlight - Box - Item Spacing
searchWidget.options.box.itemSpacing.description: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.
searchWidget.options.box.itemSpacing.markdownDescription: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.

searchWidget.options.box.itemSpacingOnAl.title: User Spotlight - Box - Apply Item Spacing on all items
searchWidget.options.box.itemSpacingOnAl.description: Apply the item spacing even on the first and last items.
searchWidget.options.box.itemSpacingOnAl.markdownDescription: Apply the item spacing even on the first and last items.

searchWidget.options.box.spacing.all.title: All
searchWidget.options.box.spacing.all.description: Set the spacing for all sides of the component. Equivalent to setting the top, bottom, left, and right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.
searchWidget.options.box.spacing.all.markdownDescription: Set the spacing for all sides of the component. Equivalent to setting the top, bottom, left, and right. Numeric units will be interpreted as pixels.

searchWidget.options.box.spacing.vertica.title: Vertical

searchWidget.options.box.background.size.markdownDescription: Set the background size of the component. [MDN Reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-size)

searchWidget.options.box.background.imag.title: image
searchWidget.options.box.background.imag.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".
searchWidget.options.box.background.imag.markdownDescription:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

searchWidget.options.box.background.unse.title: Ignore Default Background
searchWidget.options.box.background.unse.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
searchWidget.options.box.background.unse.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

global.links.colors.focus.description: Set the color for when the item is focused. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)
global.links.colors.focus.markdownDescription: Set the color for when the item is focused. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

global.links.colors.clickFocus.title: Focus Color (Click)
global.links.colors.clickFocus.description: Set the color for when the item is focused (specifically after being clicked). Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

global.links.colors.keyboardFocus.title: Focus Color (Keyboard)
global.links.colors.keyboardFocus.description: Set the color for when the item is focused (specifically using the keyboard). This can often be used to provide a very obvious focus color for users navigating with a keyboard, and a more subtle one for users with a pointing device. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

This can often be used to provide a very obvious focus color for users navigating with a keyboard, and a more subtle one for users with a pointing device. global.links.colors.active.title: Active Color

global.links.colors.active.markdownDescription: Set the color for the item when it is active (like when it is being touched or clicked.). Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

global.links.colors.visited.title: Visited Color

global.links.colors.allStates.title: All State Colors

global.links.colors.allStates.markdownDescription: Set a color for the item during any non-default state (hover, active, focus, visited). Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

global.spacer.mainLayout.title: Main Layout
global.spacer.mainLayout.description:
Controls spacing around main layouts like panel layouts.
When there are breadcrumbs this controls above the breadcrumbs.
global.spacer.mainLayout.markdownDescription:
Controls spacing around main layouts like panel layouts.
When there are breadcrumbs this controls above the breadcrumbs.

global.spacer.pageComponent.title: Page Component
global.spacer.pageComponent.description: Controls spacing around and inside of most top level site widgets placed in the top level of a page.
global.spacer.pageComponent.markdownDescription: Controls spacing around and inside of most top level site widgets placed in the top level of a page.

global.spacer.pageComponentCompact.title: Page Component Compact
global.spacer.pageComponentCompact.description:
Controls spacing around and inside of most widgets placed in the top level of a page **on mobile device sizes**.
Additionally this value is used for widgets placed inside of the main panel in panel layouts on all device sizes.
global.spacer.pageComponentCompact.markdownDescription:
Controls spacing around and inside of most widgets placed in the top level of a page **on mobile device sizes**.
Additionally this value is used for widgets placed inside of the main panel in panel layouts on all device sizes.

global.spacer.panelComponent.title: Panel Component
global.spacer.panelComponent.description: Controls spacing around and inside of most widgets placed inside of a secondary/side panel.
global.spacer.panelComponent.markdownDescription: Controls spacing around and inside of most widgets placed inside of a secondary/side panel.

global.spacer.headingBox.title: Heading Box
global.spacer.headingBox.description: Controls spacing below heading boxes (a heading box includes a title, optional description, and optional subtitle). This will be used in addition to the `headingItem` spacing.
global.spacer.headingBox.markdownDescription: Controls spacing below heading boxes (a heading box includes a title, optional description, and optional subtitle). This will be used in addition to the `headingItem` spacing.

global.spacer.headingBoxCompact.title: Heading Box Compact

**This compact version is used on viewport sizes.**
global.spacer.headingBoxCompact.markdownDescription:

**This compact version is used on viewport sizes.**

global.contentBoxes.depth2.background.im.title: image
global.contentBoxes.depth2.background.im.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.

global.panelBoxes.depth3.background.imag.title: image
global.panelBoxes.depth3.background.imag.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

userSpotlight.options.box.borderType.title: Border Type
userSpotlight.options.box.borderType.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
userSpotlight.options.box.borderType.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

userSpotlight.options.box.itemSpacingOnA.title: User Spotlight - Box - Apply Item Spacing on all items

userSpotlight.textContainer.font.color.title: Color
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.color.description: Sets the color the components's text. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.color.markdownDescription: Sets the color the components's text. Hexidecimal colors preferred (Either #RRGGBB or #RRGGBBAA)

userSpotlight.textContainer.font.size.title: Size
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.size.description: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.size.markdownDescription: Indicates the desired height of glyphs in the applied font. Numerical units will be applied as pixels, for example '12' will be interpreted as '12px'.

userSpotlight.textContainer.font.weight.title: Weight
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.weight.description: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.weight.markdownDescription: Specifies weight/boldness of glyphs in the applied font.

userSpotlight.textContainer.font.lineHei.title: Line Height
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.lineHei.description: Sets the distance between lines of text.
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.lineHei.markdownDescription: Sets the distance between lines of text.

userSpotlight.textContainer.font.shadow.title: Text Shadow
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.shadow.description: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.shadow.markdownDescription: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element. Allows any formats of [the CSS 'text-shadow' property.](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/text-shadow)

userSpotlight.textContainer.font.align.title: Alignment
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.align.description: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.align.markdownDescription: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.

userSpotlight.textContainer.font.transfo.title: Transform
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.transfo.description: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.
userSpotlight.textContainer.font.transfo.markdownDescription: Specifies how to capitalize an element's text. It can be used to make text appear in all-uppercase or all-lowercase, or with each word capitalized.

userSpotlight.userTitle.font.shadow.title: Text Shadow

userSpotlight.userTitle.font.align.markdownDescription: Describes how text contents are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill their container.

leaderboard.title.background.image.title: image
leaderboard.title.background.image.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

discussionList.contentBoxes.depth1.borde.title: Border Type
discussionList.contentBoxes.depth1.borde.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.
discussionList.contentBoxes.depth1.borde.markdownDescription:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".
categoryList.contentBoxes.depth1.backgro.markdownDescription:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".

categoryList.contentBoxes.depth1.backgro.title: Ignore Default Background
categoryList.contentBoxes.depth1.backgro.description: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.
categoryList.contentBoxes.depth1.backgro.markdownDescription: Some components have a built-in background. In these scenarios setting this variable to true will remove the default background, even if other background properties are not specified.

categoryList.contentBoxes.depth2.borderT.title: Border Type
categoryList.contentBoxes.depth2.borderT.description:
Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

Choose one of a few border types.

- none: Apply no styling on the box.
- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

categoryList.contentBoxes.depth2.itemSpa.title: Depth 2 - Item Spacing
categoryList.contentBoxes.depth2.itemSpa.description: For certain border types, there is space between in items. This is that space in pixels.

- border: Apply a standard border around the item. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `global.border` variables to change this border.
- shadow: Apply a standard "widget" box shadow. Automatically applies spacing as well. See the `shadow.widget` variables to change this shadow.
- separator: Apply top and bottom separators to the item. Automatically applies vertical spacing.

profile.contentBoxes.depth2.background.i.title: image
profile.contentBoxes.depth2.background.i.description:
Set a background image or linear-gradient for the component.Note: Some special parsing may occur on this value.
- URL's beginning with a "~" character will be relative to the current theme directory. For example if the current file-based them is in /addons/themes/my-theme, ~/design/my-image.png would be equivalent to /addons/themes/my-theme/design/my-image.png
- Please pass _URLs_ for this variable. __Do not__ pass urls wrapped in "url()".
